restic.eli5: Restic is like a smart backpack that remembers what you packed, so you only carry new stuff next time.
restic.boss: Restic is a secure and efficient command-line backup tool that supports deduplication and encryption.
restic.sysadmin: Restic is a fast, encrypted, deduplicating backup program written in Go, compatible with various storage backends like S3, B2, and local disks.
restic.use_case: Used to back up home server directories to a cloud bucket with AES encryption.

duplicati.eli5: Duplicati is like a friendly robot that zips your stuff and hides it before putting it in the cloud.
duplicati.boss: Duplicati is a user-friendly backup tool that encrypts, compresses, and sends backups to various cloud storage services.
duplicati.sysadmin: Duplicati is a cross-platform backup client with a web UI, supporting scheduling, compression, and encrypted backups to cloud or local storage.
duplicati.use_case: Used to schedule encrypted daily backups of important documents to Google Drive.

urbackup.eli5: UrBackup is like a time machine for your computers that saves everything in case you mess up.
urbackup.boss: UrBackup is an open-source backup solution for disk images and file backups over the network.
urbackup.sysadmin: UrBackup combines image-based and file backups with web-based management and restore capabilities for Linux and Windows systems.
urbackup.use_case: Used to back up multiple Windows PCs to a central Linux server with easy recovery.

proxmox_backup_server.eli5: It’s a special Proxmox buddy that remembers your entire computer setup so you can rewind if something breaks.
proxmox_backup_server.boss: Proxmox Backup Server is a dedicated backup system for virtual machines, containers, and host data in Proxmox environments.
proxmox_backup_server.sysadmin: PBS offers incremental, deduplicated, encrypted backups for VMs and CTs managed by Proxmox VE, supporting fast restoration and remote storage.
proxmox_backup_server.use_case: Used to schedule daily backups of virtual machines running on Proxmox VE.

timeshift.eli5: Timeshift is like a save button for your computer that you can click to go back if something breaks.
timeshift.boss: Timeshift is a Linux system restore tool that lets you roll back to a previous working state.
timeshift.sysadmin: Timeshift uses RSYNC or BTRFS snapshots to create incremental system-level backups, excluding user data by default.
timeshift.use_case: Used to roll back a Linux system after a bad kernel update or package install.

duckdns.eli5: DuckDNS is like a name tag for your house that updates every time your address changes.
duckdns.boss: DuckDNS is a free dynamic DNS service that maps changing home IPs to a consistent domain name.
duckdns.sysadmin: DuckDNS provides dynamic DNS using simple scripts or clients to update public IPs, enabling external access to home servers.
duckdns.use_case: Used to access a home Plex server remotely via a stable domain name.

no_ip.eli5: No-IP is like a service that gives your house a friendly name so people can visit even if your address changes.
no_ip.boss: No-IP provides dynamic DNS services that link your changing IP to a consistent domain name.
no_ip.sysadmin: No-IP allows automatic updates of DNS records for dynamic IP addresses through a client or router integration.
no_ip.use_case: Used to make a home VPN accessible from the internet without a static IP.

namecheap_dns.eli5: Namecheap DNS is like a contact list for websites made by Namecheap.
namecheap_dns.boss: Namecheap DNS is the DNS hosting service provided by Namecheap to manage domain records like A, CNAME, and TXT.
namecheap_dns.sysadmin: Namecheap DNS allows domain owners to configure and manage DNS zones through their dashboard or API.
namecheap_dns.use_case: Used to point a domain to a home server or external app through A and CNAME records.

route53.eli5: Route53 is Amazon’s address book for finding websites and services quickly.
route53.boss: Route53 is AWS’s scalable domain name system that manages DNS records and routing with high reliability.
route53.sysadmin: Amazon Route53 is a highly available and scalable DNS web service with support for routing policies, health checks, and domain registration.
route53.use_case: Used to manage domains and health-checked failover routing for cloud services.

henet.eli5: HE.net is like a tunnel that helps your old internet talk with new technology.
henet.boss: HE.net provides free IPv6 tunnels and DNS hosting for networking enthusiasts and professionals.
henet.sysadmin: Hurricane Electric (HE.net) offers free IPv6 tunnel broker services, DNS management, and BGP tools for dual-stack testing and adoption.
henet.use_case: Used to add IPv6 support to a home network using their tunnel broker.
